sub_title: experienced policy advisor, retired, open for short term assignments.
summary:
I had a long and versatile career at the Custodial Institutions Agency of the Ministry of Justice and Security: first a nurse in the prison of Amsterdam, after I graduated in sociology and criminology I became policy officer and eventually a senior strategic advisor. My main expertise is prison healthcare (including addiction and mental health care) and normalization of the detention climate. I have extensive international experience. I was a member of the steering group of the WHO Health in Prisons Program (2004-2015), from 2012-2015. I was project leader of an EU project in Turkey (‘Harm reduction in prisons’), and in 2015 I was involved in an EU/Council of Europe project aimt at health care improvements in prisons in Georgia. From 2004 to date I have been in Ukraine and Belarus regularly to do assessments, give presentations and workshops and as a project leader (involving training for staff in juvenile detention centers).
In 2019 I was accepted as an expert by CPT (Committee for the prevention of Torture and Inhumane Treatment) of the Council of Europe. 
Since my retirement  I'm also involved as a  "buddy" for disadvantaged children as a volunteer at Foundation Studio 52nd, a theater group that works with children with the aim to stimulate their creativity and to increase resilience and self-confidence.

profile_positions.description:
International Charitable Foundation Aids Foundation East West (AFEW) is a non-profit organisation registered in Ukraine since 2001. The mission of AFEW Ukraine is to support public health systems by contributing to the prevention of hiv-aids and to support people affected by hiv in Ukraine, Moldova, Belarus, Georgia and Azerbaijan. AFEW is a member of a network of foundations chaired by Stichting Aids Foundation East West based in The Netherlands. 
The board consists of three members. Board members are not paid any form of honorarium. 
The role of the board members is:
- to participate in the board meetings twice a year (live or virtual)
- approval of the financial and programmatic annual reports of the management team as well as annual plans and budgets of the foundation;
- provide technical and strategic guidance of overall objectives and major programs.
profile_positions.title: Supervisory Board Member

profile_positions.description: Foundation Friends of Prylucky is a small non-profit organisation based in Sassenheim (The Netherlands). Members of the board are professionals (psychologists, managers) involved in juvenile institutions in the Netherlands. Board members are not paid any form of honorarium. The mission of Friends of Prylucky is to contribute to the development of treatment programs in juvenile institutions in Ukraine and to the re-socialisation and reintegration of the juveniles. The foundation executes low threshold, low cost projects. We provide trainings and workshops on risk assessment, psychological and educational diagnostics, positive living climate, system approach, family conference. My speciality is: drugs and (prevention of) addiction, prevention of hiv-aids and other communicable diseases and harm reduction. I give training in intervision. I am responsible for fundraising and coordinating the project activities and the implementation of trainings and workshops in good cooperation with partners in Ukraine and our donors.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Board

profile_positions.description: As a member of the committee, I assess subsidy applications that have been submitted to ZonMW. The assessment committee consists of experts from different domains who are dealing with people with disturbed behavior (experts incl the police, mental healthcare, public health service, disabled care. Experiential experts (clients and relatives) are also represented in the assessment committee.)
profile_positions.title: Member assessment committee action program local initiatives for people with disturbed behavior

company.name: Foundation Vrouwenruimte De Kat (Room for Women 'The Cat')

profile_positions.company: Foundation Vrouwenruimte De Kat (Room for Women 'The Cat')
profile_positions.description:
Vrouwenruimte De Kat (Room for Women' The Cat') gives support to migrant women and girls by strengthening their self-confidence and promoting their emancipation and independence. All personnel are volunteer: ten to twelve in total. We offer lessons in Dutch, facilitate  meetings and networking, we provide individual coaching and  activities aiming at getting familiar with  the Dutch society. I’m overall responsible for the budget, fundraising, the volunteers working for the organisation (HRM-policy, contracts, assignments etc.), the programs, the facilities, etc.
I work a lot with the municipality and with other volunteer organisations in the neighborhood.
profile_positions.title: Chair of the Board

profile_positions.description: In the framework of the Partnership for Good Governance Project 'Criminal Justice Responses to Drug Dependent Prisoners' (Ukraine) the Pompidou Group implements the research project activity on Family Conference methodology. In the course of this research I developed a workplan which serves as a guide for the researchers and others involved in the project. Together with the principal consultant I selected an international researcher and a local researcher, I selected three members of a advisory team that provides scientific and methodological advice to the researchers.  I organise and chair meetings with the researchers and the advisory team and report to the principal consultant. I liaise with and inform stakeholders and beneficiairies about the research work plan, meetings and progress made in the research. Publication of the research is expected July 2018
profile_positions.title: project consultant/coordinator research

profile_positions.description:
I was responsible for strategic policy development and knowledge management. As a member of the team ‘Prisons of the future’ I was responsible for innovative policies in prison care, safety and programs and approaches promoting rehabilitation, reintegration of detainees. I was also member of the ‘knowledge management team’ which is responsible for the strategic agenda on scientific research and knowledge-sharing. 
Achievements: 
•	I implemented a pilot ‘self-support and normalisation’in the prison of Vught: a pilot-program for 12 long-sentenced detainees. The pilot is part of the project ‘DJI of the future’, a program aiming at prison reform and implementation of innovative programs in prisons in the Netherlands. 
•	I started the monthly ‘knowledge lunch’ and the quarterly ‘in house college’. Colleagues appreciate these activities as a way to gain and to share knowledge, to discuss ideas and to network. 
•	I was the moderator of several expert meetings through which the Custodial Institutions Agency gained up-to-date knowledge which was applied for the development and implementation of prison policies.
profile_positions.title: senior strategic adviser

profile_positions.description:
I was responsible for the development of policies on prison health care, including mental health and addiction care; I was the contact person for the WHO Health in Prisons Programme (WHO-HIPP) and other international organisations, responsible for sharing information with other countries and contributed to international surveys and research.  
Achievements:
•	As project leader of the  projects ‘TBC-prevention in prison’ and ‘Hepatitis C in prisons’ I was responsible for the development of prevention and treatment  in penitentiary institutions in the Netherlands.  
•	I was the project leader of the project ‘Harm Reduction in Prisons in Turkey’, a cooperation between Ministries of Justice in Turkey and The Netherlands, financed by the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs The project was carried out in a pilot prison in Istanbul where we supported the prison governor and his staff in reforming the prison system and developing drug use and HIV prevention programmes.
profile_positions.title: senior policy adviser

profile_positions.description: As a short term consultant I contribute to the implementation of programmes/project-related activities and co-operation activities and to the achievements of their objectives in close co-operation with the Directorate General of Human Rights and Rule of Law, in particular with the Criminal Law Co-operation Unit and with relevant beneficiaries and other consultants and key players. In Georgia I was active as a consultant on behalf of  the Council of Europe for the project ‘Reform of Prison Health Care in the Georgian Penitentiary Institutions’, Council of Europe Tbilisi Office.
profile_positions.title: Consultant in the penitentiairy field (short term consultant)

company.name: Penitentiaire Inrichtingen Over Amsterdam (Prison of Amsterdam)

profile_positions.company: Penitentiaire Inrichtingen Over Amsterdam (Prison of Amsterdam)
profile_positions.description:
I was responsible for nursing care for prisoners: male and female prisoners, prisoners with addiction 
problems and mental health diseases. I contributed to care and treatment programs for prisoners suffering from HIV-Aids and to harm reduction programs. As a member of the psycho-medical team I contributed to the overall prison health care policy and detention programs. 

Achievements: 
•	I developed and implemented the prison’s HIV-Aids prevention and treatment protocol. 
.        I introduced field workers of the Mainline Foundation (an Amsterdam based harm reduction organisation working in the community) as ‘field workers’ in the prison. The quality of information about drugs and harm reduction and access to care facilities after release from prison was improved as a result of this project. In 1998 this project was awarded the ‘Gouden Bal’ (‘Golden Ball’), an award for innovative projects by the Ministry of Justice.
•	I set up medical posts for asylum seekers at the Schiphol and Amsterdam Detentions Centres, including building up a team of two medical doctors and three nurses. I was responsible for the daily management.
profile_positions.title: nurse / justitieel verpleegkundige
